# Complex Geometry

# Holomorphic Vector Bundles

# Holomorphic Vector Bundle

Let XXX be a complex manifold. A holomorphic vector bundle of rank rrr on XXX is a complex manifold EEE together with a holomorphic map

π:E⟶X\pi : E ⟶ X π:E⟶X

along with the structure of an rrr-dimensional complex vector space on any fibre Ex:=π−1(x)E_{x} := \pi^{-1}(x)Ex​:=π−1(x) satisfying the following condition:

There exists an open covering X=∪UiX = \cup U_{i}X=∪Ui​ and biholomorphic maps ψi:π−1(Ui)≅Ui×Cr\psi_{i} : \pi^{-1}(U_{i}) \cong U_{i} \times \mathbb{C}^{r}ψi​:π−1(Ui​)≅Ui​×Cr commuting with the projections to UiU_{i}Ui​ such that the induced map π−1(Ui)≅Cr\pi^{-1}(U_{i}) \cong \mathbb{C}^{r}π−1(Ui​)≅Cr is C\mathbb{C}C-linear.

A holomorphic line bundle is a holomorphic vector bundle of rank one.
